ci_support_linux_64_python3.11.____cpyth:
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.11.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
ContourPy is a Python library for calculating contours of 2D quadrilateral
grids.  It is written in C++11 and wrapped using pybind11.
about.summary: Python library for calculating contours of 2D quadrilateral grids.

raw_meta_yaml:
schema_version: 1

context:
  version: "1.3.3"

recipe:
  name: contourpy
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/contourpy/contourpy/archive/v${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c1e4d622e9d4f3081dbdb438b403e50557be7284a41d9a21316414405848ba62

build:
  number: 4
  skip: match(python, "<3.11")

outputs:
  - package:
      name: contourpy
    requirements:
      build:
        - ${{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - ${{ stdlib("c") }}
        - if: build_platform != target_platform
          then:
            - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
            - meson >=1.2.0
            - meson-python >=0.13.1
            - ninja
            - pybind11 >=2.13.2,!=2.13.3
            - python
      host:
        - pip
        - meson >=1.2.0
        - meson-python >=0.13.1
        - ninja
        - pkg-config
        - pybind11 >=2.13.2,!=2.13.3
        - python
      run:
        - numpy >=1.25
        - python
    tests:
      - python:
          imports:
            - contourpy
            - contourpy.util
          pip_check: true
      - script:
          - python -c "from contourpy.util import build_config; from pprint import pprint; pprint(build_config())"
          - python -c "import platform, sys; print(sys.version, platform.uname())"
          - pytest -v
        requirements:
          run:
            - pytest
        files:
          source:
            - tests/__init__.py
            - tests/test_minimal.py
            - tests/util_test.py

about:
  description: |
    ContourPy is a Python library for calculating contours of 2D quadrilateral
    grids.  It is written in C++11 and wrapped using pybind11.
  documentation: https://contourpy.readthedocs.io
  homepage: https://github.com/contourpy/contourpy
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_file: LICENSE
  repository: https://github.com/contourpy/contourpy
  summary: Python library for calculating contours of 2D quadrilateral grids.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ianthomas23
